ai.summary: Dryside Road Path is a short, easy 5.7 km hike in the UK, suitable for beginners and families seeking a gentle countryside stroll along a quiet route.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat or gently undulating surfaces. Tracks are a mix of tarmac or compact gravel with occasional grassy or muddy sections, especially after rain. Expect clear waymarking and minimal technical sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check local conditions before you go. Stay on the marked path, watch for road traffic on shared sections, and wear sturdy footwear. Bring water and snacks, a light layer for changes in weather, a map or a charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. In UK weather can shift quickly, so plan for rain and shorter daylight hours.
recommended_gear: Map or charged smartphone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (year-round with proper gear)
